subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Testing for Swing JTables
msgSnippet: Its easier enough to test your JTableModel implementing class, leave the JTable UI part as is - it works and you don t have to code anything other than its
messageBody:
Its easier enough to test your JTableModel implementing class, leave the
JTable UI part as is - it works and you don't have to code anything
other than its model.

Andrew
